meanings.definition: A person or group that legitimizes something.
meanings.sent1: The legitimators in the court made sure the document was valid.
meanings.sent2: The government officials were the legitimators of the new law.
meanings.sent3: The legitimators at the party were the ones who decided on the best costume.
meanings.sent4: She acted as the legitimators of truth in the debate, ensuring honesty prevailed.
meanings.sent5: The legitimators of the contest awarded the trophy to the deserving winner.

meanings.definition: The act of legitimizing or making something legitimate.
meanings.sent1: The legitimators of the contract ensured all terms were fair.
meanings.sent2: His signature was the final step in the legitimators of the agreement.
meanings.sent3: The legitimators of the game made sure everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: Her approval acted as the legitimators for the project to proceed.
meanings.sent5: The legitimators of the decision brought clarity to the situation.
